TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit ReportDataSource extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents a data source for a report.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The ReportDataSource class is used with the <xref:Microsoft.Reporting.WinForms.LocalReport.DataSources%2A> collection of a <xref:Microsoft.Reporting.WinForms.LocalReport> object to add one or more required data sources to a local report. This is necessary when adding a report to the ReportViewer control.
## Examples For code examples, see <xref:Microsoft.Reporting.WinForms.LocalReport>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string name) cil managed
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string name, class System.Collections.IEnumerable dataSourceValue) cil managed

Docs.summary: Constructs a named data source with an <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerable> object in the <xref:Microsoft.Reporting.WinForms.ReportDataSource.Value%2A> property.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string name, class System.Data.DataTable dataSourceValue) cil managed

Docs.summary: Constructs a named data source with a <xref:System.Data.DataTable> object in the <xref:Microsoft.Reporting.WinForms.ReportDataSource.Value%2A> property.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string name, object dataSourceValue) cil managed

Docs.summary: Constructs a named data source with a value.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:Microsoft.Reporting.WinForms.ReportDataSource.Value%2A> may be an instance of <xref:System.Data.DataTable>, a <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerable> value (for example, <xref:System.Data.DataView> or <xref:System.Array>), or a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.BindingSource>.
If this value is an instance of <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerable>, all elements in the collection must be of the same type, and names of the public properties of the element (as retrieved by the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor.GetProperties%2A> method) must match the field names of the corresponding report data source.
<xref:Microsoft.Reporting.WinForms.ReportDataSource.Value%2A> may also be an instance of <xref:System.Type>. In this case, an instance of the supplied type is automatically created and added to an automatically created collection.
If the type of <xref:Microsoft.Reporting.WinForms.ReportDataSource.Value%2A> is not any of the aforementioned types, it is added to an automatically created collection.
## Examples For code examples, see <xref:Microsoft.Reporting.WinForms.LocalReport>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string name, class System.Type dataSourceValue) cil managed

Docs.summary: Constructs a named data source with the <xref:Microsoft.Reporting.WinForms.ReportDataSource.Value%2A> property initialized as a particular type.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string name, class System.Windows.Forms.BindingSource dataSourceValue) cil managed

Docs.summary: Constructs a named data source with a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.BindingSource> object in the <xref:Microsoft.Reporting.WinForms.ReportDataSource.Value%2A> property.
Gets or sets the name of the report data source.
Gets or sets the instance of the report data source.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Value may be an instance of <xref:System.Data.DataTable>, a <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerable> value (for example, <xref:System.Data.DataView> or <xref:System.Array>), or a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.BindingSource>.
If this value is an instance of <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerable>, all elements in the collection must be of the same type, and names of the public properties of the element (as retrieved by the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor.GetProperties%2A> method) must match the field names of the corresponding report data source.
Value may also be an instance of <xref:System.Type>. In this case, an instance of the supplied type is automatically created and added to an automatically created collection.
If the type of Value is not any of the aforementioned types, this property throws an exception.
